meanings.definition: A person whose life is devoted to the pursuit of pleasure and luxury.
meanings.sent1: The group of friends were known as voluptuaries because they always sought pleasure and luxury.
meanings.sent2: The city's elite were considered voluptuaries, indulging in lavish parties and extravagant vacations.
meanings.sent3: The voluptuaries decided to have a luxurious picnic in the park, complete with gourmet food and fine wine.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, she was a voluptuary, always chasing after the latest trends and designer labels.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the protagonist as a voluptuary, living a life filled with opulence and hedonism.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed paintings of famous voluptuaries from history.
meanings.sent2: At the costume party, many guests dressed up as voluptuaries from different eras.
meanings.sent3: The book club members jokingly referred to themselves as the voluptuaries of literature.
meanings.sent4: The art exhibition featured sculptures representing ancient voluptuaries enjoying life's pleasures.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the actors portrayed a group of wealthy voluptuaries living in decadence.
